metadata.title: Integrative taxonomy reveals a new unstriped Ichthyophis Fitzinger, 1826 from Vietnam and provides new data on diagnostic osteological traits for Asian tailed caecilians (Gymnophiona: Ichthyophiidae)
metadata.description:
Abstract

Herein we examined the cranial osteology of 15 species of Ichthyophis (I. asplenius, I. beddomei, I. glutinosus, I. kohtaoensis, I. larutensis, I. mindanaoensis, I. multicolor, I. nguyenorum, I. nigroflavus, I. sikkimensis, I. singaporensis, I. supachaii, I. tricolor, I. weberi, and Ichthyophis sp. from northern Vietnam) with a special emphasis on the temporal region. We presented the first detailed description of the cranium and the atlas of an Ichthyophis species based on micro-CT scanning data. We discuss the implications of temporal region composition for the systematics of this group and the evolution of the cranium in Gymnophiona as a whole. We further provided comments on a jaw-closing mechanism and reported on the presence of phylogenetically basal cranial features in ichthyophiids that are also found in stem caecilians. Our detailed morphological description was based on a specimen from a previously unknown population of unstriped Ichthyophis from northern Vietnam. We consequently described this population as a new species based on morphological and molecular (3967 bp from cyt b, 12S rRNA, and 16S rRNA mitochondrial DNA genes) lines of evidence. We provide comparisons of external morphological traits of the new species with its congeners and further compare its cranial osteological features with other Ichthyophis for which skull descriptions exist. The new species differs from the morphologically similar species I. yangi and I. chaloensis by a significant divergence in cyt b and 16S rRNA mitochondrial DNA gene sequences (p = 6.5%–6.9% and p = 4.5%, respectively). The new species is currently known only from evergreen forests of Xuan Lien National Park (Thanh Hoa Province) and Pu Hoat (Nghe An Province) Nature Reserve, northern Vietnam, and was recorded at elevations of 700–800 m asl. We suggest the new species be considered Data Deficient (DD), following the IUCN's Red List categories.

metadata.title: Global biogeochemical tracers simulated by the CESM2-MARBL under present and future climate conditions
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the outputs of ocean biogeochemistry tracers and tracer fluxes from twelve simulations conducted using the Community Earth System Model version 2, Marine Biogeochemistry Library (CESM2-MARBL) model.

Among them, four GIAF_** experiments were conducted using the active ocean-sea ice configuration of CESM2 under present-day climate forcing. The default model was forced with the Japanese 55-year reanalysis dataset (JRA-55) for the period 1958–2018 and was first spun up for four full cycles to reach a quasi-steady state in the upper ocean. In the fifth cycle, the ocean state from the year 1990 was used as the initial condition for the sensitivity experiments. From this point, the fifth cycle proceeded along two branches: (1) the control simulation (GIAF_control): a continuation of the default run without any temperature sensitivity modifications; and (2) three sensitivity experiments, each incorporating different temperature parameter modifications. Each experiment ran through the end of the fifth cycle, and the outputs here are the final ten year (2009–2018) monthly averaged tracer concentrations and fluxes.

Eight B** experiments were performed using the fully coupled CESM2 under both historical and future climate forcings. Future climate simulations were conducted under IPCC’s SSP3-7.0 and SSP5-8.5 emission pathways. Three B**_control experiments were conducted using the default model forced by historical and future climate conditions: BHIST_control (historical), BSSP370_control (SSP3-7.0 scenario), and BSSP585_control (SSP5-8.5 scenario). Five sensitivity experiments are branched from the years 1975 (historical) and 2075 (future), and extended for 25 years. Among them, B**_PftZooRemin_variedq10 incorporated both plankton-specific Q10 values and temperature-dependent POM remineralization, while B**_PftZooOMRemin_q10 additionally included temperature-dependent DOM remineralization. The outputs here are decadal averages of the final ten years of each simulation (1990s and 2090s). Detailed descriptions of these simulations are provided in Li et al. (2025).

data.title: Global biogeochemical tracers simulated by the CESM2-MARBL under present and future climate conditions

metadata.title: Synthesis, Characterization, and Evaluation of the Antibacterial Activity of Some Novel Thiazolo- [1,2,4] Triazolo [1,5-a] Pyridine Derivatives
metadata.description: Abstract: A novel four-step scientific protocol has been reported for the synthesis of thiazolo- [1,2,4] triazolo[1,5-a] pyridine and its derivatives (6a-c) as target moieties in good overall yields by using 1-(2-(Trifluoromethyl)-5-methylthiazol-4- yl) ethanone (1) as starting compound. The IR, PMR, Mass spectral data, and elemental analysis validated the chemical structures of all the intermediates and products. Furthermore, the newly synthesised intermediates and final derivatives were screened for their antibacterial activity against different bacterial strains, and it was found that a few of them exhibited noteworthy antibacterial activity with varying degrees of disparity.

metadata.title: Supplementary files for "Determining Impact Angle from the Spatial Distribution of Shock Metamorphism: A Case Study of the Gosses Bluff (Tnorala) Impact Structure, Australia"
metadata.description:
This publication includes:

  • PDF data: planar deformation feature measurements and shock pressure assignments for sandstone samples from the Gosses Bluff impact structure.
  • Input files for the iSALE numerical model to investigate the spatial distribution in shock metamorphism with impact angle, with parameters tuned to the Gosses Bluff structure:
    • *asteroid.txt: asteroid input file for iSALE for that model run
    • *material.txt: target material input file for iSALE for that model run
  • GB_processing.py: the python script used for analysis of the simulations, including extracting tracer pressures and plotting pressure distributions.

metadata.title: Network Management and Cybersecurity Fundamentals
metadata.description:
This textbook is used internally at several higher education institutions in Egypt for teaching network management and cybersecurity fundamentals. It is not available for commercial sale. Only the cover and table of contents are publicly accessible for academic documentation and citation purposes.

This comprehensive teaching guide covers network infrastructure, hardware, protocols, and security layers from fundamental concepts through advanced implementation. Content includes LANs, WANs, wireless networks, routers, switches, OSI model, TCP/IP, IPv4/IPv6, firewalls, encryption, operating system security, TIA/EIA connectivity standards, and hands-on network simulation using Cisco Packet Tracer. Designed for NET201: Network Management and Cybersecurity Fundamentals course.

First printing: 2014. Reprinted with updates: 2020.

metadata.title: Classifying polish in use-Wear analysis with convolutional neural networks
metadata.description:
Lithic use-wear analysis examines micro- and macroscopic traces on tool surfaces resulting from human use and post-depositional processes. Polish, formed through surface abrasion with different materials, is a key diagnostic feature that is increasingly analyzed using machine learning to enhance automation and standardization. However, further research is needed to explore whether deep learning approaches, in particular, can be effectively applied to use-wear analysis and to determine the optimal surface area size (e.g., patch size and microscope objectives) and model architecture (custom vs. pre-trained) for achieving the best results. This study employs convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to classify experimental polish based on contact material (wood, hide, bone) and use intensity, while also assessing optimal imaging and analytical parameters.

The results of this exploratory study suggest that CNNs may effectively identify polish from bone and hide but perform less effectively with wood. The models also successfully distinguish between polish formed by short- and long-term use. Custom models outperformed pre-trained ones, particularly when using images that captured smaller areas of the tool’s surface, suggesting that bigger surface areas may lack the necessary information for optimal results. These findings underscore the need to expand use-wear datasets in terms of size and variability and optimize CNN architectures and workflows.

metadata.title: Phylogenetic analysis suggests early divergence followed by convergent morphological evolution in the Silene sections Odontopetalae and Sordidae (Caryophyllaceae)
metadata.description: The genus Silene presents significant taxonomic challenges, particularly for groups such as S. sect. Odontopetalae and the monotypic S. sect. Sordidae. This study investigates the evolutionary relationship between the narrowly endemic Silene sordida and the widespread S. odontopetala to resolve these ambiguities. Using a multispecies coalescent framework with five genetic markers and expanded taxon sampling, the species tree and divergence times were estimated. The results revealed a moderately supported sister relationship between S. sordida and S. sect. Odontopetalae, with their divergence estimated at approximately 5.5 million years ago, following the Messinian salinity crisis. Despite their profound morphological and ecological differences, the results suggest a shared evolutionary origin. This study underscores the limitations of morphology-based classification in Silene and highlights the critical roles of ecological divergence, historical biogeography, and convergent evolution in shaping the genus's diversity. The results provide a clearer understanding of the evolutionary processes driving diversification in these complex lineages.

metadata.title: Harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset from six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris (France) from 2022-06-10 to 2024-03-05
metadata.description:
Quality controlled and harmonized dataset on wind direction and wind speed profiles from ground-based Doppler Wind LIDARS (DWL), deployed in a multi-institutional effort along a 40 km transect through the centre of the Paris Metropolitan area (France) for the period 2022-06-10 to 2024-03-05.

The dataset, its derivation, quality control and evaluation against radiosondes and in-situ observations are decribed in the following manuscript:

Morrison, W., Looschelders, D., Céspedes, J., Claxton, B., Drouin, M.-A., Dupont, J.-C., Faucheux, A., Haeffelin, M., Holst, C. C., Kotthaus, S., Masson, V., McGregor, J., Price, J., Zeeman, M., Grimmond, S., and Christen, A.: Harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset from six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris, France, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-2025-167, 2025.

Preview graphs for the full dataset on a daily basis (wind speed, wind direction, wind barbs) are available here:

https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15090857 

Continuous data availability consists of

  • Extensive Operation Period (EOP) with 3 DWLs from June 10, 2022 – March 05, 2024
  • Two Intensive Observation Periods (IOPs) with six DWL over 9 weeks in September 2023 to December 2023. 

Detailed data availability per site along with weather conditions and classifications can be found in the files "paris_dwl_L3V1.39_data_availability_weather.pdf" and "paris_dwl_L3V1.39_data_availability_weather.xlsx".

Data are provided in daily NetCDF files in two temporal resolutions of 10 minutes ("_600s") and 1 hour ("_3600s"). All dates / times are in UTC. Files are packaged by year and month using the following name convention "paris_dwl_L3VX.XX_YYYY_MM_RRRRs.tar.gz", where X.XX is the version number, YYYY refers to the year, (2022-2024) MM to the month of the year (01-12), and RRRR is the time resolution with "600s" and "3600s".

NetCDF files contain the following fields:

standard_name (Variable name) Dimensions Description
time 1 Timestamp: end of time interval. 600 s and 3600 s time intervals are provided, in separate data files (600 s e.g. 00:00:01 → 00:10:00 and 3600 s e.g. 00:00:01 → 01:00:00). All variables are harmonised to this resolution as averages (e.g. wind) or percentage occurrence (e.g. flags) 
altitude 1  Altitude of centre of each measurement gate above mean sea level (m). Harmonised gates are 25 m from 0 – 6500 m with values linearly interpolated to this resolution 
station 1 Measurement location identifier (see table below), all are listed even if no valid data are retrieved during the file’s date. 
eastward_wind (u)  3 Mean eastward wind component (m s-1) using all valid samples within time interval 
northward_wind (v)  3 Mean northward wind component (m s-1) using all valid samples within time interval 
wind_speed (ws)  3 Horizontal wind speed calculated from eastward_wind and northward_wind (m s-1) 
wind_from_direction (wd)  3 Horizontal wind direction calculated from eastward_wind and northward_wind (degrees from true north) 
system_id  2 Serial number of sensor deployed at station at a given time 
latitude (station_lat)  1 Latitude of the measurement station (degrees, decimal, WGS84) 
longitude (station_lon)  1 Longitude of the measurement station (degrees, decimal, WGS84) 

station_altitude 

1 

Measurement station height above ground level (m).  

Ground level is the “street” level so if the station is on a rooftop, the height will accounts for the building height and any mounting structure 

station_height 

 1  Average height of station above sea level (reference_geoid: EGM96) (m) 

n_rays_in_scan 

2 

Number of rays in a scan. e.g. 12 for a VAD scan that has 12 samples within one scan 

n_pulses 

2 

Number of pulses in a given ray. More pulses, the higher the integration time 

raw_gate_length 

2 

Gate length prior to L3 aggregation (m) 

flag_suspect_retrieval_warn 

3 

Percentage of values within time interval with retrieval warning not linked to low signal (flag_low_signal_warn_pc) or out of range (flag_ws_out_of_range_removed_pc). Retrievals retained but treat with caution 

flag_suspect_retrieval_removed 

3 

Percentage of values within time interval with retrieval error not linked to low signal (flag_low_signal_warn_pc) or out of range (flag_ws_out_of_range_removed_pc). Data removed 

flag_low_signal_warn 

3 

Percentage of values within time interval with a low SNR. Retrievals retained but treat with caution 

flag_low_signal_removed 

3 

Percentage of values within time interval with a low SNR. Retrieval rejected 

flag_ws_out_of_range_removed 

3 

Percentage of values within time interval with wind speed outside reasonable retrievable range (> 60 m s-1) (i.e. removed). Evaluated after all other retrieval QC 

 

Version history

Version 1.42

  • Selected additional values at the station PAROIS have been flagged and/or removed due to suspicion of an instrument falfunction. Data have been compared to a co-located SODAR to assess data quality (see manuscript for details)
  • Weather data files (paris_dwl_L3V1.42_data_availability_weather.xlsx and paris_dwl_L3V1.42_data_availability_weather.pdf) have been corrected for an error in the column "Precipitation (mm day-1) MF Montsouris Weather Station" (previously incorrect atribution to day), for the correct highlighting of weekend days and they have been expanded to include sunrise, sunset and solar noon times.

data.title: Harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset from six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris (France) from 2022-06-10 to 2024-03-05

metadata.title: Preview graphs of the harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset from six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris (France) from 2022-06-10 to 2024-03-05
metadata.description:
Daily overview graphs in png format of vertical profiles of wind speed, wind direction and wind barbs from a harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset based on six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris (France). The dataset itself is available here:

https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14761503

This repository contains only preview graphs of the data for browsing and inspection. Graphs cover the period 2022-06-10 to 2024-03-05 and refer to data version 1.42.

Files are separated into three products:

  • 'paris_dwl_L3V1-42_profile_barbs.tar.gz' contains daily plots of vertical wind speed and direction graphed as differently colored wind barbs measured with up to six DWLs. 
  • 'paris_dwl_L3V1-24_profile_ws.tar.gz' contains daily plots of vertical wind speed profiles measured with up to six DWLs. Additionally, for reference wind speed measured at Meteo France station on Tour Eiffel and at Montsouris (WMO station ID 071560) are shown. 
  • 'paris_dwl_L3V1-24_profile_wd.tar.gz' contains daily plots of vertical wind direction profiles measured with up to six DWLs. Additionally, for reference wind speed measured at Meteo France station on Tour Eiffel and at Montsouris (WMO station ID 071560) are shown. 

All plots have the naming convention `paris_dwl_L3V1-24_AA_toBBBBm_YYYY-MM-DD.png`, where `AA` is the type of the product ("barbs" for wind barbs, "ws" for wind speed, and "wd" for wind direction), `BBBB` is the height in meters above sea level to which the graph is shown (higher data are clipped), and `YYYY` is the year, `MM` the month, and `DD` the day for which data are shown. All times are given in UTC. Heights of wind speen and wind direction profiles are up to 1250 m, for wind barbs two versions are given, up to 1400 m and up to 3500 m.

The dataset, its derivation, quality control and evaluation against radiosondes and in-situ observations are decribed in the following manuscript:

W Morrison W, Looschelders D, Cespedes J, Claxton B, Drouin M-A, Dupont J-C , Faucheux A, Haeffelin M, C Holst, Kotthaus S, Masson V, McGregor J, Price J, Zeeman M, Grimmond S, Christen A. (2025): Harmonised boundary layer wind profile dataset from six ground-based doppler wind lidars in a transect across Paris, France, prepared for Earth Systems Science Data
